subject: NoClassDefFoundError ... grrr, gnash, rend ... frustration.
msgSnippet: Howdy all, I just started playing with junit today, and I m having some trouble getting the Runners to load my tests. I type java junit.swingui.TestRunner
messageBody:
Howdy all,

I just started playing with junit today, and I'm having some trouble getting
the Runners to load my tests.

I type "java junit.swingui.TestRunner RepServiceClientTest"
(RepServiceClientTest is a valid class and is on my Classpath, problem also
occurs with text and awt runners)

The runner gets as far as "Load Test Case ..." and then throws the following
exception:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
RepServiceClientTest (wrong
name:Openratings/junit/rep/client/RepServiceClientTest)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at
junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass(TestCaseClassLoader.java:104)
at
junit.runner.ReloadingTestSuiteLoader.load(ReloadingTestSuiteLoader.java:9)
at
junit.runner.BaseTestRunner.loadSuiteClass(BaseTestRunner.java:129)
at junit.runner.BaseTestRunner.getTest(BaseTestRunner.java:32)
at junit.swingui.TestRunner.runSuite(TestRunner.java:617)
at junit.swingui.TestRunner.start(TestRunner.java:753)
at junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(TestRunner.java:59)

I looked at the source and it seems like junit stores the class name from
args[], uses it to populate the "Test Class Name:" field in the GUI, then
later throws that away and reads the text from the "Test Class Name:" field
and uses that to call the test cases.

I *think* that is the point at which the exception is being thrown.

Here are the relevent bits of my code:

public class RepServiceClientTest extends TestCase
{

public RepServiceClientTest( String name ){
super(name);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(RepServiceClientTest.class);
}

//Test Suite:

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite("RepServiceClientTest
Suite");
suite.addTest(
new
RepServiceClientTest("testGetSummaryRatingResponse") {
protected void runTest() {
testGetSummaryRatingResponse();
}
} );
// other tests are added ...
return suite;
}

//various tests ...
}

I'm relatively new to java and so I'm betting there is some utterly obvious
problem that I'm too frustrated to see ... any help would be muchly
appriciated.

Thanks,

Joe
